program:
# good
start_loc = get_current_location()
go_to("elevator")
while True:
    if is_in_room("person"):
        response = ask("", "Are you here for the tour?", ["Yes", "No"])
        if response == "Yes":
            say("Welcome to the university!")
            break
    time.sleep(1)
go_to("conference room")
say("I have arrived at the conference room.")
say("Enjoy your visit here!")

program:
# bad: does not wait until there is a person
start_loc = get_current_location()
go_to("office")
if is_in_room("person"):
    response = ask("", "Are you here for the tour?", ["Yes", "No"])
    if response == "Yes":
        say("Welcome to the university!")
        go_to("conference room")
        say("I have arrived at the conference room.")
        say("Enjoy your visit here!")
description: bad: does not wait until there is a person

program:
# bad: take person to confrence room ONLY if response is yes
start_loc = get_current_location()
go_to("elevator")
while True:
    if is_in_room("person"):
        response = ask("", "Are you here for the tour?", ["Yes", "No"])
        if response:
            say("Welcome to the university!")
            break
    time.sleep(1)
go_to("conference room")
say("I have arrived at the conference room.")
say("Enjoy your visit here!")
description: bad: take person to confrence room ONLY if response is yes

program:
# bad: answer yes does not break the infinite loop
start_loc = get_current_location()
go_to("elevator")
while True:
    if is_in_room("person"):
        response = ask("", "Are you here for the tour?", ["Yes", "No"])
        if response == "Yes":
            say("Welcome to the university!")
            go_to("conference room")
            say("I have arrived at the conference room. Enjoy your visit here!")
    time.sleep(1)
description: bad: answer yes does not break the infinite loop

program:
# bad: answer "no" results in being taken to the confrence room
start_loc = get_current_location()
go_to("elevator")
while True:
    if is_in_room("person"):
        response = ask("", "Are you here for the tour?", ["Yes", "No"])
        say("Welcome to the university!")
        break
    time.sleep(1)
go_to("conference room")
say("I have arrived at the conference room.")
say("Enjoy your visit here!")
description: bad: answer no results in being taken to the confrence room

program:
# bad: answer of "no" does not result in continuing to wait
start_loc = get_current_location()
go_to("elevator")
while True:
    if is_in_room("person"):
        response = ask("", "Are you here for the tour?", ["Yes", "No"])
        if response == "Yes":
            say("Welcome to the university!")
        break
    time.sleep(1)
go_to("conference room")
say("I have arrived at the conference room.")
say("Enjoy your visit here!")
description: bad:  answer of no does not result in continuing to wait
